note.p: Birth: The family seat, Ochtertyre, Crieff, Perthshire, Scotland (06 February 1772)
Death: His residence, 5 Belgrave Square, London (28 July 1846)
Burial: By his wife in Kensal Green cemetery, London

Career: Entered the Army (1789); Quarter Master General in the Peninsular War; Chief of Staff with the army in Paris (for 3 years); Lieutenant General of the Ordnance; Privy Councillor; Commander in Chief, Ireland; Secretary of State for the Colonies; MP for Perth (1823); General (1841)
